goal.ch: Acquire fundamental knowledge of equilibrium statistical physics and apply it to solve problems.
goal.en: Acquire fundamental knowledge of equilibrium statistical physics and apply it to solve problems.

outline.ch:
0. Brief review of thermodynamics and some background from probability theory
1. The statistical basis of thermodynamics
2. Elements of ensemble theory
3. The canonical ensemble
4. The grand canonical ensemble
5. Formulation of quantum statistics
6. The theory of simple gases
7. Ideal Bose systems
8. Ideal Fermi systems
9. Non-ideal systems: Ising model et cetera
Prerequisites: An introductory (undergraduate level) course on thermal physics and quantum physics; a familiarity with graduate quantum mechanics I is helpful but not required.

textbook.ch:
Main textbook: Statistical Mechanics, Fourth Edition, R. K. Pathria and Paul D. Beale, Academic Press (2021) [accessible electronically via the NCU library with eBook ISBN: 9780081026939]. 

Other useful references (1 ＆ 2 are the most relevant ones): 
1. Statistical Physics of Particles, M. Kardar, MIT OpenCourseWare [https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/8-333-statistical-mechanics-i-statistical-mechanics-of-particles-fall-2013/]. 

2. Statistical Mechanics, Second Edition, Kerson Huang, Wiley (1987) [see also the online lectures delivered at NTU: https://ocw.aca.ntu.edu.tw/ntu-ocw/ocw/cou/102S112].


3. Introduction to Modern Statistical Mechanics, D. Chandler, Oxford University Press (1987).

4. Statistical Mechanics in a Nutshell, Luca Peliti, Princeton University Press (2011).

5. Statistical Physics I: Equilibrium Statistical Mechanics, Second Edition, M. Toda, R. Kubo, and N. Saito, Springer (1992). 

6. Statistical Mechanics: An Advanced Course with Problems and Solutions, R. Kubo, Elsevier (1965).

7. Statistical Mechanics, Franz Schwabl, Springer (2002) [eBook ISBN: 9783662047026].

8. Statistical Physics, W. Nolting, Springer (2018) [eBook ISBN: 9783319738277].

9. Statistical Mechanics: An Introductory Graduate Course, A. J. Berlinsky and A. B. Harris, Springer (2019) [eBook ISBN: 9783030281878]. 

10. Statistical Mechanics: Entropy, Order Parameters and Complexity, Second Edition, James P. Sethna, Oxford University Press (2021) [https://sethna.lassp.cornell.edu/StatMech/].
